fields.headline: Ins and outs
fields.bodyText: Norman Warner, the health minister, has announced his resignation. Lord Warner, 66, a former chair of the youth justice board for England and Wales, and ex-social services director, said he wanted to "spend more time with his family". Warner was appointed a junior health minister in 2003. Director of policy and external relations at Big Lottery, Vanessa Potter, is leaving to pursue a career in consultancy. John Calcutt, the chief executive of English Partnerships (EP), the government regeneration agency, has been seconded to an official review of "green" housing. Calcutt joined the agency in March. EP operating officer, John Walker, will become interim chief executive. The move comes in advance of an expected merger of EP and the Housing Corporation. Mark Carriline has quit as strategic director of children's and young people's services at Bradford city council. Carriline, who took up the post in July after four years at the council, blames the pressures of commuting for his departure. Economic development agency Cumbria Vision has appointed Richard Greenwood as chief executive. Greenwood joins from Gloucestershire learning and skills council, where he was area director.
